com.karangandhi.networking.core

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.karangandhi.networking.core.Context

  • public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a class that creates a context. This class will be responsible of all the threads, tasks that will be running in the background

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Context.OnStartCallback
      This is a callback which will be called when the context starts

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task t)
        Adds a task to the Context
        Parameters:
        t - The task to be added

      • start

        public void start()
           throws TaskNotCompletedException
        Starts the context. This method will assign all the threads to the asynchronous tasks and call the onInitialise and the onComplete method of the task
        Throws:
        TaskNotCompletedException - This is thrown when there is a exception that arises while completing the task

      • getTaskLength

        public int getTaskLength()
        Get the length of the task queue
        Returns:
        The length of the remaining tasks

      • pause

        public void pause()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Pauses the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - This is thrown when any thread is interrupted

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the context if it is paused

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the context killing all the threads

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns the state of the context: if it is running or not
        Returns:
        true if the context is running

      • getFirstTask

        public Task getFirstTask()
        Gets the first task in the queue
        Returns:
        The first task in the queue

      • addOnStartCallback

        public void addOnStartCallback(Context.OnStartCallback callback)
        Adds a callback that will be called when the context starts
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be added

      • getActiveTasks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getActiveTasks()
        Fetches all the active tasks
        Returns:
        All the active tasks of the context
